topComments.comment: Roma ha questo museo con strumenti rari meravigliosi ed allestimenti confortevoli. Valorizzato rispetto a decenni fa. E' un'esperienza entusiasmante visitarlo e mi ha sorpreso come quando sono andata a Palazzo Merulana.

topComments.author: Jordan Lui
topComments.comment: (Tradu√ß√£o do Google) Definitivamente um museu √∫nico e hist√≥rico, mas eu acho que a equipe do museu realmente precisa para acelerar as coisas. Literalmente, metade das exposi√ß√µes est√£o fechadas at√© "n√£o sabemos quando" e n√£o reduzem o pre√ßo de admiss√£o. Eu acho que isso √© fundamentalmente injusto. A parte do museu que eu poderia visitar era ador√°vel, e o dispositivo de passeio de √°udio ingl√™s inclu√≠do √© √∫til e claro para ouvir. O layout do museu √© bom para que voc√™ possa ver os instrumentos de perto e de cada √¢ngulo. Olhe para o primeiro quarto em turn√™ no segundo andar, onde voc√™ pode ver o primeiro pianoforte j√° constru√≠do! Em resumo, √© um museu encantador e passei provavelmente uma hora na metade do museu que estava aberto. No entanto, √© dif√≠cil n√£o se sentir roubado quando metade das exposi√ß√µes est√£o fechadas e eles n√£o s√£o apolog√©ticos.  (Original) Definitely a unique and historic museum but I think the museum staff really need to step things up. Literally half of the exhibitons are closed until "we don't know when" and they don't reduce admission price. I think that is fundamentally unfair. The portion of museum that I could visit was lovely, and the included English audio tour device is useful and clear to hear. Museum layout is nice so that you can view instruments closely and from each angle. Look for the first room on tour right on the second floor where you can see the first pianoforte ever built! In summary it's a lovely museum and I spent probably one hour on the half of museum that was open. However it's hard to not feel ripped off when half the exhibits are closed and they aren't apologetic at all.

(Original) It's a very small and quiet museum but a must see for musicians. The lutes and theorbos are the main instruments which are beautifully preserved. The entrance can be a bit tricky to find but you need to walk into the area though the gates then along the building until you start to see some signs.
